snippet: The Obama administration said that it would exempt seven more nations, but not China, from sanctions against countries and banks that do business with Iran.
abstract: Obama administration announces that it will exempt seven major importers of Iranian oil from sanctions against countries and banks that do business with Iran, but notably does not give China an exemption.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said that it would exempt seven more nations, but not China, from sanctions against countries and banks that do business with Iran.

headline.seo: U.S. Exemptions From Iran Oil Sanctions Leave Out China
headline.main: China Is Excluded From Waivers for Oil Trade With Iran
headline.print_headline: China Given No Waiver From Iran Oil Sanctions
